text: Hello team! I am Merve and I am interested in HubSpot APIs and webhooks for live chat. I am totally beginner in HubSpot products and services. I need help and have some questions, I found this community I hope I can find someone. I am working on the chat integration using webhooks and APIs. I have a chatbot and I want to use this chatbot in the Hubsbop live chats. Basically, whenever a new message comes to the inbox I want to trigger a webhook to my end, I want to send the answer from my end to live conversations. I read lots of documents related to webhooks, chat flows, and conversation APIs. However, I could not find how I can set up this. I have already a developer account and a trial test account. Is this possible with the webhooks? I tried to set up a bot from scratch and configure the chat flow in HubSpot. Then I choose the trigger webhook option after the welcome message. Somehow, I see the request on my end, but then the conversation ends, I just could not figure out how to automatize this for each incoming message from the users. I hope I explained my problem and it is understandable, I am truly sorry if my first message on this channel is too long. Thank you!

I managed to create a public app to use webhook and listen to the events. However, I can not list this app without active users and verification. So I can not select this app as a connected app for my test account. If I create a private app for my test account, webhook is not allowed for the private apps. I just could not figure out how to proceed with that.

Hello here,

I’m trying to use HubSpot HubDB API with `@HubSpot/api-client` but just as some people noted, there are *many* mistakes in their *documentation* and code samples which mostly *does not work* on copy/paste.

I could fix some cURL samples, managed some JavaScript but I’m having headache to use `updateDraftTable`.

I’m getting
```    status: 'error',
    message: 'The HubDbTable ra_generated_delete does not exist.',```
although it *exists* and I tried to use *ID* and it is published.

The same JSON body *works* with *cURL.*

Any ideas?

@here I have a client connecting a custom system HC1 to HubSpot to have a 1-way push - they are using a single text field that will sync at the end of each day for "total samples" question-since that field is overwritten, does HubSpot keep a historical record of what that field was? Meaning the sales team wants to identify samples sent traneds-so if a client send less one month from the previous month is there anyway to know/pull that data like-total in Field X was X in march, but now is X in april?

Hello everyone, I'm developing a fastapi app which has an endpoint to request HubSpot all contacts, I'm using paging and everything, it works, but after some time I get an ApiException 401 saying my access token has expired 0 seconds ago before being able to get all contacts on HubSpot, do you guys have any tips to work around this error?
I'd like to host my blog on my own. Is it possible to have an email from HubSpot automatically be sent when the blog post is published -- via RSS Feed or API?!

You use the Files API. This will add an item to the File Manager. These files can be public or private.
Public files are for items like images you would put on a website page. Private files are most often then associated to a CRM Engagement and used for things like the PDF of a customer contract that is associated to a Deal

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/files/files>

If your intention is to upload a file and associate to a CRM record, I wrote this tutorial. It includes a diagram, a video explanation, a Postman collection that you can customize, and a list of steps:
<https://4069828.fs1.HubSpotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/4069828/Solution%20Architecture%20Docs/Tutorial_%20Add%20Attachments%20to%20CRM%20Records.pdf>

Sounds like you oAuth access token is expiring before the job completes pulling all contacts. This is likely if you are pulling lots and lots of pages of contacts.

You should build in error handling logic that when you get this specific exception, you use the 'Get new access token' endpoint to get a new token, then continue your job pulling contacts from where you left off
Hey Nick - wondering if you googled this one first :slightly_smiling_face:
Clearly not well enough -- TY for jumping in and  providing feedback.
haha - I don't mean to sound too salty :smile:
Good luck and hope that helps
are you wanting something like this?
you should be able to find this on the CRM objects docs.  For example, this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|one for contacts>
thank you@dennis edson-i will send this to the integrations team and see if this will solve for that.

if im reading your image right-if they write a historical query it will allow the sales manager to compare account usage for the custom property to be (as example) in march 1000 samples sent, then in april pull a report to see how much that has increased, or remained the same month over month-so the sales rep can reach out and ask if they are having trouble sending samples (if in case it  remains flat)

I was wondering if anyone has used the HubSpot API to acquire Call logs?
I'm trying to get call logs for a specific time period.

I am having a hard time finding just the right one.
Get all engagements: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-all-engagements>
Last 30 days or 10K engagements: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-recent-engagements>
Get call results only: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/engagements/get-call-dispositions>

The latest HubSpotAPI seems to only reference from Call ID.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/engagements>

If you have a better way to do this, I'd love to know. Thanks
